comment: Morphy always brought every piece into play as quickly as possible. To play the same piece twice in the opening was a breach of principle. Only under the influence of such players as Reti and Breyer, about 1920, was it realized that in some cases it can be good. The present position is such a case: White could obtain a definitie advantage with 10. Bb5!
reasoning: The comment offers a potential explanation for the mistake, suggesting a focus on rapid piece development, which is a common flaw.
